intro: Turraeanthus vignei, commonly known as the Vigne's turraeanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Turraeanthus vignei is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact size and attractive floral display.
